ISSUE.TITLE: Bug: Unexpected M2M columns being created
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Please enter the following details** M2M columns are created unexpectedly. See below steps to reproduce. **Steps To Reproduce** Supposing you have 3 tables A, B, and C, each contains several records. 1. In table A, create a M2M column linking to table B. The M2M column can be created successfully. 2. In table A, create a M2M column linking to table C. The M2M column can be created successfully. However, the M2M column created in step 1 got duplicated N times. (See screenshot) P.S. m2mA_B table looks normal though. **Expected behavior** No duplicate / unexpected columns are created. **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35857179/125299624-e6e18300-e35b-11eb-9fea-803f0f121aa0.png) Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.10.1**

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix(api): Avoid duplicate M2M column re #338 Signed-off-by: Pranav C <61551451+pranavxc@users.noreply.github.com>
